everything about grid
section
unit keywords parent container children container miscs
main home
unit
fr

portion of the remaining space

go to top
keyword
repeat()

grid-template-row repeat(3, 1fr) repeat 1fr in row side for 3 times

min-content

grid-template-row repeat(3, min-content) row flexible makes line break may overflow fix overflow for min-content as applied on grid-template-column, makes the grid-template-row flexible as having min-content

max-content

grid-template-column repeat(3, max-content) column flexible makes no line break no overflow

minmax()

grid-template-column repeat(min-content, minmax(10rem, 1fr)) minmax(first, second) it can not be more than the defined max size [initial element size] & it can not be less than the defined min size!

fit-content()

grid-template-column repeat(fit-content, 10rem) fit-content() uses the space available, but never less than min-content and never more than max-content

auto-fill

grid-template-column repeat(auto-fill, 5rem) auto-fill Fit as many possible columns as possible on a row, even if they are empty

auto-fit

grid-template-column repeat(auto-fit, 5rem) auto-fit Fit whatever columns there are into the space. Prefer expanding columns to fill space rather than empty columns

parent container
row side

grid-template-row [define row size] grid-template-row define how many row needed

grid-template-row [first-start] 1fr [first-end second-start] 10rem [second-end] grid-template-row [with naming grid cell]

justify-items stretch[default] center | end | start justify-items apply effects on main axis

justify-content stretch | start | end | center | space-around | space-between | space-evenly justify-content when the total size of grid is less than the container size... then this this property works for main axis (x)

column side

grid-template-column [define column size] grid-template-column define how many column needed

align-items stretch [default] | start | end | center | baseline align-items apply effect on cross axis / verticle side

align-content stretch | start | end | center | space-between | space-around | space-evenly align-content when the total size of grid is less than the container size... then this this property works for cross axis (y)

other properties for parent container

gap [row gap] [Column gap] gap shorthand property for row-gap and column gap

grid-auto-rows [size] grid-auto-row define height for implicit cell for row side

grid-auto-columns [size] grid-auto-columns define width for implicit cell for column side

grid-auto-flow row[default] | column | row dense | column dense grid-auto-flow shorthand for grid-auto-row property and grid-auto-columns property

children items
children items

grid-row [row-start-line] / [row-end-line] grid-row define row height for grid children item

grid-column [col-start-line] / [col-end-line] grid-column define column width for grid children item

justify-self stretch [default] | start | end | center justify-self override parent container justify items [main-axis] definition

align-self stretch [default] | start end center align-self override parent container align-items [cross-axis] definition

miscs
explaining useful template

grid-template-column repeat(auto-fit, minmax(min-content, 25rem)) grid-template-column intially, if the parent container has enough space, the elements will defaultly have 25rem && as the container size decrease & the elements can not have 25rem... it will simply apply min-content which means, contents will have flexible row size

famous snippets

grid-template-columns repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr))

famous snippets

grid-template-columns repeat(auto-fill, minmax(200px, 1fr))
